title: Carol Vorderman sports red dragon top in support of Welsh rugby team
text:
Carol Vorderman was in Japan watching the Wales v Uruguay rugby match

Carol Vorderman showed her support for Wales in their Rugby World Cup match against Uruguay on Sunday in Japan and she is seriously rocking the team colours.

The seasoned television star was decked out in a top featuring the iconic Welsh dragon, as well as high-waisted dark trousers we’ve become accustomed to seeing her in, boots and sunglasses.

In a series of photos, the 58-year-old Welsh TV star can be seen on her phone while in the crowd of the rugby match.

Then she asked a passerby, who was all too obliging, to take a photo of her in front of the ongoing game.

Carol Vorderman supporting Wales at the Rugby World Cup in Japan (Picture: Michael Steele/Getty Images)

Carol Vorderman supporting Wales at the Rugby World Cup in Japan (Picture: Michael Steele/Getty Images)

Another photo showed the former Countdown star posing in front of a sign with the Welsh team, as she raised her hands in the air like she was primed to catch the rugby ball.

(In case you were wondering, Wales smashed Uruguay 35-13… and Carol’s cheering probably had a hand to play in it!)

She seems to be loving life right now, which comes after the star revealed she has a ‘number of lovers’ and isn’t planning on settling down.

Carol is a fan of her belted trousers (Picture: @carolvorders)

In a candid chat, Carol revealed she has a bunch of ‘special friends’ she gets up to ‘a lot of mischief’ with.

‘I get up to a lot of mischief. I have a number of special friends — but I’m not doing anything wrong. Everyone’s single. And yes, apart from one, they’re all younger than me,’ she said.

‘[If I name names] I’ll have broken the code. I never mention them, and they don’t talk about me.’

Which is fair…

Taking a few tips from James Bond, she added to the Daily Mail: ‘If I told you who they were, I’d have to kill you! I don’t want to settle down. I’m enjoying my freedom.’

Carol has been married twice, with her first marriage, to Christopher Mather, ending in 1986 after a year.

She also shares two children – Cameron and Katie – with second husband Patrick King, whom she divorced in 2000, after a decade together.
